title.rendered: Share The Best Views In NYC With Your Roommate

content.rendered:
New York City is often portrayed in movies as gritty, rough, and industrial. But the truth is, there’s a lot of beauty in The Big Apple. Parks, trams, bridges, and rooftop bars provide ample opportunities to share the best views in NYC with your roommate. So grab your beverage of choice, text your roommate, and meet up at these locations at sunset. Or, if you’re the fitness enthusiast type, sunrise. Just make sure you’re roommate is also an early riser before you prod them awake with your running shoe at 5 am.

Go to the Highline Park with your Roommate in NYC

The Highline Park is relatively new to the New York scene compared to other parks. Set up in 1999, it is the result of an effort to save a historical piece of New York’s rail system from demolition. Instead of laying waste to the elevated railway, Friends of the Highline managed to save it and turn it into a beautiful park. They use some really cool self-seeding techniques that make it easier to maintain the natural beauty of the area.

https://in.pinterest.com/pin/333759022392231039/

Related: Fun Things To Do In Manhattan In A Single Weekend!

Roosevelt Island Tram

If you’re looking for more of a ride than a walk, check out the Roosevelt Island Tram. It connects Roosevelt Island to the Upper East Side of Manhattan. On Fridays and Saturdays, it’s open from 6:00 am to 3:30 am so you can get your fill of sunrises, sunsets, and afternoon sunshine. You can use your metro card, and they use the same fare structure. It’s a cheap but fun way to ride along with your roommate and see NYC from a whole new perspective.

https://in.pinterest.com/pin/82190761935215104/

The Brooklyn Bridge

No conversation about the best views in NYC would be complete without mentioning the Brooklyn Bridge. You can get fantastic views on and around the bridge. Restaurants galore offer spectacularly lit night views in the area. So, if you live in NYC, this is something you must do with your roommate. The biggest drawback to the Brooklyn Bridge is that it’s hardly a well-kept secret so you might want to wear eye protection to avoid wayward cameras on selfie sticks as they careen about with uncontrolled enthusiasm.

https://in.pinterest.com/pin/606156431098266790/

Related: A New York Travel Guide For Long Vacations

Enjoy the The Press Lounge with your roommate in NYC

The Press Lounge has some impressive views, and they know it. Their homepage immediately capitalizes off of their stunning scenery with slick, fast loading movies of the view. Modern, stylish, elegant, with a dash of natural setting, this place offers amazing food with a side of stellar views. In other words, this is a really fun way to spend a weekend with your roommate in NYC. On the other hand, this memorable experience has only one drawback: you get three guesses, and all of them are expensive.

https://in.pinterest.com/pin/145170787975870723/

One World Observatory

You’d be hard pressed to find anywhere that offers a better panoramic view of the entire city. The One World Observatory is more than a view. While New York City is an icon of America, this place puts a very special emphasis on international community. Firstly, the welcome center greets you in 10 different languages. After that, as you ride up the sky pod elevator, you’re given a condensed tour of 500 years of NYC history. The main observatory on the 100th floor then offers some awe-inspiring views of the entire city. So, if you only had one choice, this might be the very best for views of NYC with your roommate.

https://in.pinterest.com/pin/600878775283050647/

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find the best views to enjoy with their roommate in NYC? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
